trans-unit.source: Use Mobile Services to upload images to blob storage (Windows Phone) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Mobile Services to upload images to blob storage (Windows Phone) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Mobile Services to upload images to Azure Blob Storage.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Mobile Services to upload images to Azure Blob Storage.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to enable your Windows Phone 8 or Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight app to upload and store user-generated images in Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to enable your Windows Phone 8 or Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight app to upload and store user-generated images in Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: Mobile Services uses a SQL Database to store data.
trans-unit.target: Mobile Services uses a SQL Database to store data.

trans-unit.source: However, binary large object (BLOB) data is more efficiently stored in Azure Blob storage service.
trans-unit.target: However, binary large object (BLOB) data is more efficiently stored in Azure Blob storage service.

trans-unit.source: You cannot securely distribute with the client app the credentials required to securely upload data to the Blob Storage service.
trans-unit.target: You cannot securely distribute with the client app the credentials required to securely upload data to the Blob Storage service.

trans-unit.source: Instead, you must store these credentials your mobile service and use them to generate a Shared Access Signature (SAS) that is used to upload a new image.
trans-unit.target: Instead, you must store these credentials your mobile service and use them to generate a Shared Access Signature (SAS) that is used to upload a new image.

trans-unit.source: The SAS, a credential with a short expiration—in this case 5 minutes, is returned securely by Mobile Services to the client app.
trans-unit.target: The SAS, a credential with a short expiration—in this case 5 minutes, is returned securely by Mobile Services to the client app.

trans-unit.source: The app then uses this temporary credential to upload the image.
trans-unit.target: The app then uses this temporary credential to upload the image.

trans-unit.source: In this example, downloads from the Blob service are public.
trans-unit.target: In this example, downloads from the Blob service are public.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add functionality to the <linkText>GetStartedWithData sample app project</linkText><title></title> to take pictures and upload the images to Azure by using an SAS generated by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add functionality to the <linkText>GetStartedWithData sample app project</linkText><title></title> to take pictures and upload the images to Azure by using an SAS generated by Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Visual Studio 2013, or a later version
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Visual Studio 2013, or a later version

trans-unit.source: [Windows Phone SDK 8.0] or higher
trans-unit.target: [Windows Phone SDK 8.0] or higher

trans-unit.source: Nuget Package Manager installed for Microsoft Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Nuget Package Manager installed for Microsoft Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Storage account[how to create a storage account]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Storage account[how to create a storage account]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Complete the tutorial <linkText>Add Mobile Services to an existing app</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Complete the tutorial <linkText>Add Mobile Services to an existing app</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: This tutorial only support Windows Phone 8 and Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight apps.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial only support Windows Phone 8 and Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight apps.

trans-unit.source: It does not support Windows Phone Store 8.1 or universal Windows 8.1 apps.
trans-unit.target: It does not support Windows Phone Store 8.1 or universal Windows 8.1 apps.

trans-unit.source: To be able to use an SAS to upload images from your app to Blob storage, you must first add the NuGet package that installs Storage client library for Windows Store apps.
trans-unit.target: To be able to use an SAS to upload images from your app to Blob storage, you must first add the NuGet package that installs Storage client library for Windows Store apps.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer in Visual Studio, right-click the client app project and select Manage NuGet Packages.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer in Visual Studio, right-click the client app project and select Manage NuGet Packages.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, select the Online category, select Include Prerelease, search for WindowsAzure.Storage-Preview, click Install on the Azure Storage package, then accept the license agreements.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, select the Online category, select Include Prerelease, search for WindowsAzure.Storage-Preview, click Install on the Azure Storage package, then accept the license agreements.

trans-unit.source: This adds the client library for Azure storage services to the project.
trans-unit.target: This adds the client library for Azure storage services to the project.
